herptest.extract_lms_archive.main()[source]

herptest.run_test_suite module

This is the driver source code for the herp utility to run the project test suite as specified by the user.

herptest.run_test_suite.build_project(source_root, build_root, build_cfg)[source]

Builds the project that will be tests

Parameters

source_root: str

The Source directory path

build_root: str

The Build directory path

build_cfg: str

The Build directory path for the Configuration file

Return

result_error: BaseException

An error flag for any issue raised when building the project

error_output: str

An output message that provides further detail of the error

herptest.run_test_suite.main()[source]

Handles the herp utility build, test, and shutdown routines

herptest.run_test_suite.parse_arguments()[source]

Handles command line arguments and creates usage message

Returns

config: argparse.Namespace

Namespace object that holds the argument context.

herptest.run_test_suite.prepare_and_init_framework(cfg)[source]

Build the environment components (only need to do this once.)

Parameters

cfg: Config

Test Suite Configuration that has initialized values (paths adjusted to the absolute paths)

Return

framework_data: dict

A dictionary that holds framework context values

herptest.toolbox module

class herptest.toolbox.PipeSet[source]

Bases: object

Class wrapping python pipes as a set to make it easier to read / write them

print(*argv, **kwargs)[source]
println(*argv, **kwargs)[source]

write(bytes)[source]
class herptest.toolbox.SelectiveFileHandler(filename, mode='a', encoding=None, delay=0, add_level=True, **keywords)[source]

Bases: FileHandler

emit(record)[source]

Emit a record.

If the stream was not opened because ‘delay’ was specified in the constructor, open it before calling the superclass’s emit.

If stream is not open, current mode is ‘w’ and _closed=True, record will not be emitted (see Issue #42378).

class herptest.toolbox.SelectiveStreamHandler(stream=None, add_level=False, **keywords)[source]

Bases: StreamHandler

emit(record)[source]

Emit a record.

If a formatter is specified, it is used to format the record. The record is then written to the stream with a trailing newline. If exception information is present, it is formatted using traceback.print_exception and appended to the stream. If the stream has an ‘encoding’ attribute, it is used to determine how to do the output to the stream.
